channel.title: Posts on Husig.ai
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Husig.ai

item.title: Full Stack Engineer [Mid/Senior]
item.description: We’re looking for an experienced [Mid/Senior] Full Stack Engineer (MERN) to architect and build scalable applications with AI-powered features while leading technical initiatives across our engineering organization. As a Full Stack Engineer at HuSig, you’ll work on complex systems including event management platforms, AI-powered lead generation tools, and data analytics ecosystems. This role combines hands-on development with technical leadership, mentoring, and strategic decision-making for optimal cloud solutions. Key Responsibilities Full-Stack Development & AI Integration (50%) Architect and develop scalable web applications using React.

item.title: Graphic Designer [Mid/Senior]
item.description: We’re seeking a creative and versatile [Mid/Senior] Graphic Designer to lead our visual design efforts across multiple platforms and marketing initiatives. As a Graphic Designer at HuSig, you’ll create engaging visual content for our AI-powered platforms, marketing campaigns, and brand initiatives. You’ll work on diverse projects from event marketing materials to user interface designs, while collaborating with international partners and mentoring design team members. Key Responsibilities Visual Design & Brand Development (50%) Create compelling visual designs for event marketing materials, promotional content, and brand assets Develop consistent visual identity across multiple platforms and product lines Design user interface elements and marketing collaterals for AI-powered applications Create social media graphics, email templates, and digital advertising materials Design print materials including brochures, banners, and event signage Maintain brand guidelines and ensure consistency across all visual communications Collaborate on website design and landing page optimization Creative Strategy & Campaign Development (30%) Lead creative strategy for marketing campaigns and product launches Develop visual concepts that align with business objectives and target audience needs Create compelling presentations and pitch decks for client meetings and partnerships Design infographics and data visualizations for complex AI and analytics concepts Conceptualize and execute creative campaigns for lead generation and brand awareness Work closely with marketing team to translate business goals into visual solutions Team Leadership & Collaboration (20%) Mentor junior designers and provide creative guidance and feedback Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and marketing teams on project requirements Present design concepts and rationale to stakeholders and clients Manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines and quality standards Contribute to design system development and maintain design asset libraries Stay updated with design trends and best practices in AI, tech, and event industries Required Qualifications Experience & Portfolio 2+ years of professional graphic design experience with a strong portfolio Proven experience in brand development and visual identity design Demonstrated ability to create designs for both digital and print media Experience working with tech companies or AI/data-focused organizations preferred Portfolio showcasing variety in design styles and project types Technical Skills Proficiency in design tools: Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) Experience with Canva, Figma, and collaborative design platforms Knowledge of web design principles and responsive design concepts Basic understanding of UI/UX design principles (bonus compensation consideration) Familiarity with design collaboration tools (Miro, Excalidraw, FigJam) Understanding of print production processes and digital asset optimization Creative & Soft Skills Strong visual storytelling abilities and creative problem-solving skills Excellent understanding of typography, color theory, and composition Ability to adapt design style to match different brand voices and target audiences Strong communication skills for presenting ideas and receiving feedback Detail-oriented approach with ability to work under tight deadlines Leadership qualities with experience mentoring team members Preferred Qualifications UI/UX design experience with modern design systems (additional compensation) Experience with motion graphics and video editing software Knowledge of HTML/CSS for web design implementation Understanding of conversion optimization and performance marketing design Experience designing for AI/ML applications or technical products Photography and photo editing skills Experience with design thinking methodologies What We Offer Competitive compensation package with additional pay for UI/UX skills Health insurance coverage Learning and development budget for design courses and tools Access to premium design software and creative tools Opportunity to work with international SF-based technology partners Creative freedom with direct impact on brand and product development Collaborative environment with cross-functional teams How to Apply Please submit your resume along with a comprehensive design portfolio showcasing your best work across different mediums and industries to [ayush@husig.

item.title: AI Engineer [Associate]
item.description: We are seeking a talented AI Engineer Associate to join our engineering team and help build innovative AI-powered solutions, with a primary focus on developing a Real Estate AI-based CRM and other HuSig products. This role is perfect for someone who has strong coding fundamentals, understands data structures and algorithms, and is excited about working with modern AI technologies and full-stack development. You’ll be contributing to production systems that serve real customers, and gaining hands-on experience with cutting-edge AI technologies including large language models, voice AI, and intelligent automation systems.

item.title: Data Analysis & Customer Operations [Entry level/Internship]
item.description: We’re looking for a motivated entry-level professional to join our fleet management operations team and grow your skills in data analysis and customer operations. As a Data Analysis & Customer Operations Associate at Drivra Mobility (official partner of Yango), you’ll work directly with fleet management systems, analyze driver performance data, and communicate with customers to ensure optimal fleet operations. This role offers comprehensive training and mentorship from both Drivra Mobility and HuSig teams, making it perfect for someone starting their career in data analysis or customer operations.

item.title: Flutter Developer [Mid/Senior]
item.description: We’re looking for a skilled Flutter developer to join our growing engineering team and help build next-generation mobile applications with AI-powered features. As a Flutter Developer at HuSig, you’ll work on diverse mobile projects including event management platforms, lead generation systems, and AI-integrated applications. This role offers the opportunity to work with modern technologies while mentoring junior developers and contributing to our technical architecture decisions. Key Responsibilities Mobile Application Development (60%) Develop and maintain cross-platform mobile applications using Flutter framework Implement AI-powered features including intelligent recommendations and automated content generation Integrate with REST APIs and real-time data systems Build responsive UIs that work seamlessly across iOS and Android devices Optimize app performance, memory usage, and battery consumption Implement secure authentication and payment processing workflows Work with geolocation services, push notifications, and device-specific features Code Quality & Architecture (25%) Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code following best practices Implement proper state management patterns (Provider, Bloc, Riverpod) Ensure comprehensive testing coverage including unit, widget, and integration tests Participate in code reviews and contribute to technical design discussions Maintain consistent UI/UX patterns across applications Optimize build processes and deployment pipelines Team Collaboration & Mentoring (15%) Mentor junior developers and provide technical guidance Collaborate closely with backend engineers, designers, and product managers Participate in sprint planning, retrospectives, and technical architecture meetings Share knowledge through internal tech talks and documentation Contribute to mobile development best practices and standards Required Qualifications Experience & Skills 2+ years of professional Flutter development experience Strong understanding of Dart programming language and Flutter ecosystem Experience with state management solutions (Provider, Bloc, GetX, or Riverpod) Proficiency in integrating RESTful APIs and handling asynchronous operations Knowledge of mobile app deployment processes for both iOS and Android Experience with version control systems (Git) and collaborative development workflows Technical Proficiencies Flutter framework and Dart language expertise Material Design and Cupertino design principles Firebase integration (authentication, analytics, cloud messaging) Local data storage solutions (SQLite, Hive, SharedPreferences) Third-party package integration and dependency management Basic understanding of native iOS/Android development concepts Experience with testing frameworks and debugging tools Soft Skills Strong problem-solving abilities and analytical thinking Excellent communication skills for cross-functional collaboration Mentoring mindset with patience for teaching and guiding others Self-motivated and able to work independently while being a team player Attention to detail and commitment to delivering quality code Preferred Qualifications Experience with AI/ML integration in mobile applications Knowledge of payment gateway integrations (Stripe, PayPal) Understanding of mobile security best practices Experience with CI/CD pipelines for mobile applications Familiarity with backend technologies and database concepts Contributions to open-source Flutter projects or packages What We Offer Competitive compensation package Health insurance coverage Learning and development budget for courses and conferences Opportunity to work with international SF-based partners Direct impact on product development and technical decisions Collaborative and growth-oriented work environment Modern office setup with latest development tools How to Apply Please submit your resume along with a portfolio of your Flutter applications (App Store/Play Store links or GitHub repositories) to [ayush@husig.

item.title: Marketing/Lead Generation [Associate]
item.description: We’re seeking a data-driven Marketing/Lead Generation Associate to spearhead our lead intelligence initiatives and build comprehensive datasets that drive business growth. As a Marketing/Lead Generation Associate at HuSig, you’ll focus on identifying, researching, and qualifying potential clients through systematic data collection and analysis. This role combines marketing research, data curation, and strategic outreach to build robust lead generation systems that support our partnerships with international technology companies. Key Responsibilities Lead Research & Data Collection (50%) Conduct systematic research to identify potential event organizers, venue operators, and industry stakeholders Perform manual research using various online tools and platforms to find contact information Work with technical team members to improve data collection processes and efficiency Build and maintain comprehensive databases of leads with detailed contact information and business details Research industry trends, competitor activities, and market opportunities in the events space Verify and organize lead information to ensure accuracy and completeness Monitor social media, industry publications, and event platforms for emerging opportunities Data Analysis & Forecasting (25%) Analyze lead information to identify patterns, trends, and high-value prospects Create simple models to predict which leads are most likely to convert into clients Develop rating systems to prioritize leads based on quality, timing, and business potential Generate insights and reports on lead quality, market segments, and growth opportunities Track and measure how well different lead generation methods are working Work with technical teams to improve data collection processes based on findings Keep detailed records of research methods and information sources Marketing Support & Outreach (25%) Develop targeted outreach strategies based on lead research and analysis Create compelling marketing content and messaging for different prospect segments Support email marketing campaigns and social media outreach initiatives Coordinate with business development team on lead qualification and handoff processes Assist in creating marketing materials including case studies, presentations, and proposals Monitor campaign performance and optimize messaging based on response rates Research and identify potential partnership opportunities and strategic alliances Required Qualifications Experience & Skills 0-2 years of experience in marketing research, lead generation, or business research Strong analytical skills with ability to work with information and identify patterns Proficiency in research methods and online information gathering Experience with customer relationship management and lead tracking Strong internet research skills and ability to find contact information Excellent written and verbal communication skills for outreach and reporting Technical Proficiencies Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills including formulas, pivot tables, and data analysis Experience with research tools (LinkedIn, Google, industry websites) Basic familiarity with online research and data organization Knowledge of email platforms and basic marketing tools Comfortable learning new software and working with technical team members Analytical & Soft Skills Strong attention to detail and data accuracy Systematic approach to research and data organization Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously Creative problem-solving skills for finding hard-to-locate information Strategic thinking to understand business implications of data insights Collaborative mindset for working with engineering and business development teams Preferred Qualifications Background in events, hospitality, or entertainment industry Experience with business research and market analysis Knowledge of Excel for data organization and basic analysis Familiarity with marketing campaigns and customer outreach Understanding of events ecosystem including venues, promoters, and ticketing platforms Experience with business reporting and presentation creation Basic understanding of business operations and sales processes Day-to-Day Activities Research and identify 20-30 new qualified leads daily through online platforms and industry sources Verify and organize existing lead information for accuracy and completeness Work with technical team members to improve research processes and efficiency Analyze weekly lead generation results and prepare performance reports Conduct competitor research and market trend analysis Support outreach campaigns with personalized messaging and content creation Maintain organized records of research sources and methods What We Offer Competitive compensation package with performance incentives Health insurance coverage Learning and development budget for marketing and business research courses Opportunity to work with international SF-based technology partners Direct impact on business growth and lead generation strategy Access to premium research tools and business platforms Collaborative environment with business development and technical teams How to Apply Please submit your resume along with examples of your research work, data analysis projects, or lead generation campaigns to [ayush@husig.

item.title: [Paper Exploration] Adam: A Method for Stochastic Optimization
item.description: Author: Diederik P. Kingma, Jimmy Ba Published on 2014 Abstract We introduce Adam, an algorithm for first-order gradient-based optimization of stochastic objective functions, based on adaptive estimates of lower-order moments. The method is straightforward to implement, is computationally efficient, has little memory requirements, is invariant to diagonal rescaling of the gradients, and is well suited for problems that are large in terms of data and/or parameters. The method is also appropriate for non-stationary objectives and problems with very noisy and/or sparse gradients.

item.title: [Paper Exploration] Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition
item.description: Author: Kaiming He, Xiangyu Zhang, Shaoqing Ren, Jian Sun Published on 2015 Abstract Deeper neural networks are more difficult to train. We present a residual learning framework to ease the training of networks that are substantially deeper than those used previously. We explicitly reformulate the layers as learning residual functions with reference to the layer inputs, instead of learning unreferenced functions. We provide comprehensive empirical evidence showing that these residual networks are easier to optimize, and can gain accuracy from considerably increased depth.

item.title: [Paper Exploration] In-Depth Analysis of the Segment Anything Model (SAM)
item.description: Authors: Alexander Kirillov, Eric Mintun, Nikhila Ravi, Hanzi Mao, Chloe Rolland, Laura Gustafson, Tete Xiao, Spencer Whitehead, Alexander C. Berg, Wan-Yen Lo, Piotr Doll√°r, Ross Girshick Published on 2023 The Segment Anything Model (SAM) was developed by Meta AI as a foundation model for image segmentation tasks. The goal of SAM is to create a universal model that can efficiently handle various segmentation tasks with minimal prompting. Abstract We introduce the Segment Anything (SA) project: a new task, model, and dataset for image segmentation.

item.title: [Paper Exploration] Train Once, Test Anywhere: Zero-Shot Learning for Text Classification
item.description: Author: Pushpankar Kumar Pushp, Muktabh Mayank Srivastava Published on 2017 Abstract Zero-shot Learners are models capable of predicting unseen classes. In this work, we propose a Zero-shot Learning approach for text categorization. Our method involves training model on a large corpus of sentences to learn the relationship between a sentence and embedding of sentence’s tags. Learning such relationship makes the model generalize to unseen sentences, tags, and even new datasets provided they can be put into same embedding space.

item.title: [Paper Exploration] Statistical Modeling: The Two Cultures
item.description: Abstract There are two cultures in the use of statistical modeling to reach conclusions from data. One assumes that the data are generated by a given stochastic data model. The other uses algorithmic models and treats the data mechanism as unknown. The statistical community has been committed to the almost exclusive use of data models. This commitment has led to irrelevant theory, questionable conclusions, and has kept statisticians from working on a large range of interesting current problems.

item.title: [Paper Exploration] An Image is Worth 16x16 Words: Transformers for Image Recognition at Scale
item.description: Authors: Alexey Dosovitskiy, Lucas Beyer, Alexander Kolesnikov, Dirk Weissenborn, Xiaohua Zhai, Thomas Unterthiner, Mostafa Dehghani, Matthias Minderer, Georg Heigold, Sylvain Gelly, Jakob Uszkoreit, Neil Houlsby Published as a conference paper at ICLR 2021 Abstract While the Transformer architecture has become the de-facto standard for natural language processing tasks, its applications to computer vision remain limited. In vision, attention is either applied in conjunction with convolutional networks, or used to replace certain components of convolutional networks while keeping their overall structure in place.
